QUESTIONAIRE DATA CAPTURE: Specify the desired information below to request from the user. Defined field names must match the corresponding HTML name and id attributes. Click the "Help" link below to view instructions on defining custom fields. All defined fields will be stored in the description field. The HTML must include a button with onclick="doSubmit(1,'')"

PROSPECT DATA CAPTURE: Specify the desired information below to request from the user. If the Display option below is checked the custom fields will be displayed on the bottom of the page following the page content.

If the Collect option below is checked the defined custom fields will be collected from the page. The custom fields may be defined in the page content. Click the "Help" link below to view instructions on defining custom fields.

Custom fields with standard names (Company, Last Name, First Name, Title, Email, Phone, Phone2, Street, Unit, City, State, Zip, Country, Website) will be stored in the corresponding prospect fields. All other custom fields will be stored in the prospect description field.

PROCESSING URL: After the user submits their information, send their information to the following URL for processing. The URL may contain replaceable tags in curly brackets corresponding to the custom fields above. For example:
http://www.mydomain.com/Subscribe.asp?email={email}

REDIRECT URL: After the user submits their information, redirect them to the following URL. The URL may contain replaceable tags in curly brackets corresponding to the custom fields above. For example:
http://www.mydomain.com/Thankyou.asp?name={firstname}
Lead Page
Presentation Page

You can include replacable tags enclosed in curly brackets for the prospect's first name {firstname}, last name {lastname}, email {email}, phone {phone}, company name {companyname}, street {street}, city {city}, state {state}, zip {zip}, country {country}, unique identifier {id}, AND the member's name {m-name}, member's email address {m-email}, member's phone number {m-phone}, member's picture {m-image}, member's id {m-id}, member's reference # {m-ref}, member's username {m-logon} and the member's signature {signature}.
Viewed pages = black : Unviewed pages = gray
Upload Page
Click the Browse button to select a web page (.htm file) from your personal computer. After you have selected the desired web page, click the Submit button to upload it to the system.
